thnx for all your help

item.dc:creator: @SandScape SandScape
item.description:
@SandScape wrote:

I already did.[quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=343244.msg2651627#msg2651627 date=1233548414]
handle the click for that object in packet 132

[/quote]you told me that packet place but delta doesnt have that
[/quote]

Search up ‘case 132:’ in your client class.[/quote]ok now wat?

item.title: {317delta317}how to open doors.are keep them open.{317delta317}
item.dc:creator: @SandScape SandScape
item.description:
@SandScape wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:10, topic:259954”]No, that’s the name of the method and it’s parameters (which are all integers).
So the method is called like this:

ReplaceObject(int, int, int, int); [/quote]

and you still didnt tell where i should put it

Read full topic

So the method is called like this:

ReplaceObject(int, int, int, int);

item.title: {317delta317}how to open doors.are keep them open.{317delta317}
item.dc:creator: @SandScape SandScape
item.description:
@SandScape wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:6, topic:259954”]I don’t know. I don’t have Deltascape.
It could be handled in a class called objectClicking for all I know.

I’m not even sure if there’s a method in Deltascape called replaceObject.
I’ve seen it in most servers, but Delta’s server is very different.
Just find out the parameters of the method so you know how to call it.[/quote]well thnx anyway we dont have one

Read full topic

item.title: {317delta317}how to open doors.are keep them open.{317delta317}

item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

I don’t know. I don’t have Deltascape.
It could be handled in a class called objectClicking for all I know.

I’m not even sure if there’s a method in Deltascape called replaceObject.
I’ve seen it in most servers, but Delta’s server is very different.
Just find out the parameters of the method so you know how to call it.

Read full topic
